intro: Adinandra intermedia, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its wood is valued for its durability and is used in furniture and construction. Adinandra intermedia plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
